message.content:
cs.NI, cs.IT, cs.LG, cs.SY, cs.MM

The paper discusses a protocol for managing resources in the context of device-to-device (D2D) interaction among massive machine-type communication devices (MTCDs). This involves coordination among a large number of devices accessing a shared resource, which is a key challenge in network infrastructure (cs.NI). The paper also introduces a novel grouping-assisted random access protocol, which involves optimizing parameters such as group size and number of MTCDs, and evaluating the reliability of D2D links (cs.IT, cs.LG, cs.SY, cs.MM). Finally, the paper discusses the use of a Geolocation Database (GDB) capability to assist grouping decisions, which is relevant to recent regulatory-driven initiatives around GDBs (cs.NI).
